data.title: Can't drag resources into property inspector.
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Linux - Master

**Issue description:**
Dragging a *.png file into a Sprites `Texture` slot doesn't change the texture.
It also doesn't draw that orange "hey, you can drop me here" helper box anymore. 

![dnd_bug](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/8281916/25778468/9c55cb32-32fe-11e7-8d00-53bfc3e06c44.gif)

data.title: Different scroll navigations in 2d and 3d view
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Any modern laptop.

**Issue description:**
<!-- What happened, and what was expected. -->
Using the trackpad for 2 finger scrolling represents a drag in most applications nowadays (not zoom).
In godot scroll always zooms. (2d and 3d)
It would be amazing to be able to orbit (3d) + drag (2d) with the mouse pad two finger drag.

A modifier key would be used for zooming.


Proposed approaches:
add a device param to input event: enum Device (trackpad, mouse, (maybe touchscreen although the screen has different events anyways))
than in the input handler for the 3d/2d view scroll events from trackpad and mouse could be handled differently...

Just add a setting `use scrolling for pan and orbit` which than needs to be changed whenever the user switches from mouse to trackpad.

data.title: Script autocomplete is only autocompleting with file paths
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Windows 10 64bit - Godot 3 29768010126edda76229c5b14c85e7d72f1880f4

**Issue description:**
If there is a `preload()` after the code you're typing, the autocomplete will look like this:
![Not correct](http://i.imgur.com/HsEczoG.png)
If the `preload()` is before the code you're typing it will autocomplete correctly.

**Steps to reproduce:**
```GDScript
# Type code here, incorrect autocomplete
var test = preload("res://icon.png")
# Type code here, correct autocomplete
```

data.title: Normal maps in skinned/rigged meshes fail to work correctly
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Linux 64-bit (Ubuntu 16.04 LTS) Godot version 3.0 (daily build May 2)


**Issue description:**
<!-- What happened, and what was expected. -->
![normal_mapping_skeleton_issue_picture](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/25082678/25776343/cd779b7a-3289-11e7-893a-ed82c108eabe.png)

Assigning a normal map to a Spatial Material causes the mesh to become white and massively scaled up. It only seems to work for meshes that have a skeleton, even if the skeleton is empty. Normal maps work fine on the mesh if it doesn't have a skeleton.


**Steps to reproduce:**
Import a rigged model and assign a normal map to it's Spatial Material.


**Link to minimal example project:**
<!-- Optional but very welcome. You can drag and drop a zip archive to upload it. -->
Example project attached. (Cannot provide textures though, sorry! I used textures from [Free PBR](http://freepbr.com/))
[Example_project.zip](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/files/981190/Example_project.zip)

data.title: No way to tile a texture on a surface with SpatialMaterial in a general way
data.body: There is apparently no way to tile a texture on a surface in a general way in Godot 3.0 at the moment.

data.title: Cannot access keyword values in json via "." notation
data.body: If you put a "min" key (for example) in some json and attempt to access it via `json.min` the following syntax error will arise `Parse Error: Expected ',' or ')'`. Not sure if this is intended behavior or not, `json["min"]` works fine. IDK if it is worth the reward/effort ratio to fix this in the GD Script editor.

data.title: Content margin of stylebox does not work with Popup
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
all version of Godot

**Issue description:**
<!-- What happened, and what was expected. -->
Content margin value does not work with `Popup` and it's inherited `Control`s.
Would `Popup` be better inherited by `Container` instead of `Control`?

data.title: Fixed the IP resolver code blocking the main thread
data.body: This fixes issue #7881, so now the IP resolver uses a Mutex to lock its own thread (and doesn't locks globally).

data.title: Procedural Sky Shader - we love 'em, we need 'em.
data.body:
We started discussing procedural Sky Shader for Godot on IRC.
Idea is to create at least basic one for starters.

Some refs:
https://threejs.org/examples/webgl_shaders_sky.html
https://docs.blender.org/manual/en/dev/render/cycles/nodes/types/textures/sky.html
http://blog.camposanto.com/post/112703721804/this-blog-post-is-an-in-detail-explanation-of-part
https://blenderartists.org/forum/showthread.php?245954-preethams-sky-impementation-HDR

Papers:
http://www.cs.utah.edu/~shirley/papers/sunsky/sunsky.pdf
http://cgg.mff.cuni.cz/projects/SkylightModelling/HosekWilkie_SkylightModel_SIGGRAPH2012_Preprint_lowres.pdf
http://cgg.mff.cuni.cz/projects/SkylightModelling/

data.title: Editor GUI not updating
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Windows 10, 2.1.3 recent stable version

**Issue description:**
Godot's gui won't update unless I alt+tab. My drivers are up to date but I'm running on a laptop with integrated intel graphics (Intel HD 520), but from what I read intel bugs were fixed in 2.0

thanks for any help you can give me c:

data.title: Multiple inputs are being ignored.
Massive lag and OpenGL error spam on Windows with Intel graphics
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Device: Wacom Cintiq Companion 2
OS Name: Microsoft Windows 10 Pro
Version: 10.0.15063 Build 15063
System Type: x64-based PC
Processor: Intel(R) Core(TM) i7-5557U CPU @ 3.10GHz, 3101 Mhz, 2 Core(s), 4 Processors.

Graphics Render:
Renderer: Intel(R) Iris(TM) Graphics6100
Adapter RAM: 1024 MB

OpenGL Version: 4.4 / Driver version: 20.19.15.4531 29-Sep-16
DirectX Version: DirectX 9, 11.0 / Shader model vs_5_0, ps_5_0

Engine Used: **_GODOT Engine 3.0 Alpha_**

**Issue description:**
I wanted to try out the Alpha to see what new features are included, and I am aware that this engine is unstable. However, when I try to open up the engine it immediately starts to lag. This lag happens in both the viewport and any button hovered over by the mouse arrow, and the reason why this engine lags a lot is because of one error that keeps repeating in the Debug Window:

`ERROR: _gl_debug_print: GL ERROR: Source: OpenGL
	Type: Error     
	ID: 1282        
	Severity: High  
	Message: Error has been generated. GL error GL_INVALID_OPERATION in DisableVertexAttribArray: (ID: 3860911800) Generic error
		At: drivers/gles3/rasterizer_gles3.cpp:123`


**Steps to reproduce:**
Not sure if anybody is suffering the same effect after starting up the engine but clicking and opening the engine editor is the only step required to reproduce the effect mentioned above. Hope somebody might offer opinions and answers to what is causing this to happen.

data.title: Fixing previous merger's "not" vs. "!" mistake in C++
data.body: pull request #8532 from RameshRavone/patch-4 resulted in 2 lines referencing the non-existent keyword "not" in C++, causing build errors.

data.title: Fix bug in pause mode propagation
data.body:
Pause mode was not correctly propagating effectively stopping
immediately when the mode was not PAUSE_MODE_INHERIT.

Closes #8662

data.title: Node.set_pause_mode() doesn't propagate as expected
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Any, both 2.1 and master branch

**Issue description:**
`Node.set_pause_mode()` doesn't propagate as expected when the node is inside tree.

**Steps to reproduce:**
Have a Node with pause mode `process` and a sub-child with mode `inherit`. Add a timer to the subchild.
In the ready function set the sub-child pause mode to `STOP`. The timer will trigger anyway.

**Link to minimal example project:**
Contains 2 examples, one for 2.1 and one for 3.0
[pause_bug.tar.gz](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/files/980584/pause_bug.tar.gz)

data.title: Godot 3.0 primitives as resources for use with MeshInstance
data.body:
I've ported PR #8578 to Godot 3 and as suggested by @reduz changed the implementation to resources subclassed from Mesh instead of Nodes.

There are a few small fixes in this, I had calculated the normals of the cylinders wrong and you now have more freedom on the prism to move the top of the triangle in any position between left (0.0) and right (1.0).

Currently my build of Godot 3 crashes on creating materials so I have no been able to test if there are any issues with the texturing and I have no updated my test project to Godot 3.0 yet as a result.

http://docs.godotengine.org/en/stable/classes/class_visibilitynotifier2d.html

data.title: Better explain out of memory error in message queue
data.body:
Also effectively saves one unnecessary call when everything is fine.

**Please expand the file** the same condition `(buffer_end + room_needed) >= buffer_size` was in fact checked at the beginning of each indented block. Instead of failing there, another FAIL_COND_V check was performed outside of the loop.

Please bear with me and double check, I don't want to break the core but saving one `if` on every call can be a performance improvement :dancer: 

Fixes #8483 (not really a buffer overflow, more like an out of memory error).

data.title: Fixes to AudioListener2D
data.body:
This PR fixes a typo in Viewport setting the listener 2D based on the option for the 3D one.
Additionally, when calculating the distance between the camera and the voice for computing the weight of each listener, it was was not correctly normalized.

The typo is also present in `master` branch but that part is commented out since I think spatial sounds are still a work in progress.

Fixes #4195.

data.title: Fix UDP::wait() deadlock
data.body:
As explained in #4037 calling the UDP wait() function will lock the thread forever instead of returning after the first packet is received.
This PR fixes #4037 by just breaking the packet fetching loop when receiving in blocking mode (i.e. only when calling `wait()`).

I can cherry pick this to `2.1` along with 5f681d0b0f28cd39bc033c0cdf8eb3cb3a4acbe6 if everything looks okay.

data.title: 3D Editor - Zoom and Orbit.
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**

OS: Manjaro 17.0.1 Gellivara
Kernel: x86_64 Linux 4.9.24-1-MANJARO
CPU: Intel Celeron G1840 @ 2x 2.8GHz
GPU: Mesa DRI Intel(R) Haswell Desktop

Godot 2.1.3.stable.official

**Issue description:**
Using the 3D editor proves to be incredibly obnoxious when a huge mesh (or even something just big) is present in the scene. 

The zooms become useless for placing small objecs, because the closer you get, the less the view zooms. That makes, for instance, placing vegetation on a large terrain almos imposible. 

Orbiting also has a similar issue. The radius the view uses to orbit around is way too broad, so orbiting around a patch of grass is again almost imposible.

Considering the new gles3 release will receive a lot of attention on the 3D engine it has to be fixed ASAP, or it might dissapoint pretty much anyone trying for anything but a very minimal FPS.

I'm not sure if report this as a bug, because I'm not sure it is a bug either. Is this the intended behavior?

Also, I suggest implementing something similar to Blender navigation. Use the selected object or the object under the mouse pointer as pivot point and zoom/orbit target.

**Steps to reproduce:**
- Load a big terrain mesh (scale x50 in Blender).
- Load a small plant mesh or other prop, then try to operate on it (scale 1 in Blender).

**Link to minimal example project:**
I can provide one if needed.

data.title: Spotlights with shadows enabled cast light between mesh faces
data.body:
**Godot version: Master f527a6946**


**Issue description:**
Spotlight with shadows (with default values) in some positions cast some light between mesh faces.

**Steps to reproduce:**

Add a spotlight with shadows enabled and put the center near a mesh face like this:
![spotlightshadow](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/10215987/25749147/e159c066-3183-11e7-96d2-d06e3512bc02.png)

That line on the "floor" should not be there.

data.title: Lack of ambient light with more than 2 lights causes "flashing" of whole meshes
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Win 7 64 bit - Godot 3.0 (May 4 build from Fixnum)

**Issue description:**
Meshes appear to flash depending on angle to camera. The whole single mesh flashes darker or brighter, regardless of how many faces it has. (The road is made of a sequence of meshes, each mesh has quads, one quad for one half of the road, both quads flash simultaneously)

Old road version where there is a single-face mesh for each half of the road (2x as many meshes) - at the beginning, you see some meshes on the left side flash and then the ones on the right (https://gfycat.com/TintedRealFlounder) - this is 2.x (stable)


It's not shadows (they are disabled in the example project).

The issue is much more pronounced in 2.x (stable).

(https://gfycat.com/GleamingNearKoodoo) - issue in 3.0


**Steps to reproduce:**
Load the example product and move the camera around a bit.
(It's less noticeable in-game but I left the car in so that you can have a look in game too)


**Link to minimal example project:**
The example project is a 3.0 project!
[3.0flashingmeshes.zip](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/files/978351/3.0flashingmeshes.zip)

data.title: pull from godot
RingBuffer: Adds find() method
data.body: Cherry-picked from #8310

data.title: OS_Unix: Makes SIGCHLD handler wait only for stored pids
data.body: This way, #8310 won't need any modifications to `OS_Unix::execute` and almost no modifications to the forkfd thirdparty. Also now it's possible to use #8310 as a module, which will allow me to use it in GodotSharp without waiting for it to be merged.

data.title: Tree: Clear search string on selection.
data.body:
The Tree node has the ability to jump to a specific item by typing the first few chars of it's name.
But on selection (`item_activated` signal), it didn't clear the search string used for that. It was especially annoying in `FileDialog`s and has been bugging me for ages :P

With this, you can traverse a directory structure in a FileDiag quickly with the keyboard (like you'd expect from pretty much any modern file browser) :)
